alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN PHILLIPS... SOUTHEASTERN FURNAS AND SOUTHERN HARLAN COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Almena, or 15 miles northeast of Norton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stamford and Long Island around 305 PM CDT. Orleans and Woodruff around 310 PM CDT. Alma around 315 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
